How To Train Your Dragon is most definitely one of the biggest sleeper hits in recent memory. While the film got great reviews from critics, audiences never really paid it much mind, forgetting it quickly in exchange for more "toddler" oriented animated movies, such as Tangled, Rio, or 3D remade family classics such as The Lion King, and Beauty and the Beast. 'Dragon' being a PG animated film tailors towards older kids, but will be just as adored by adults for its epic action and deep and heartfelt characters. So no, this is a not a film made for 3 and 4 year old toddlers who just wanna go and see a cute animals make funny faces. Some dragons can be a bit scary for them, not to also mention the fiery action, so I'd recommend this for at least 6 years and up.
The story takes place during the Viking era and stars Hiccup, a small and skinny Viking son of a much bigger, manlier, and grander dragon-slaying father. Hiccup must compete with other kids his age in order to train to be dragon killers, yet this is the classic story of a kid who simply feels different from the others, and figures out a truth about the dragons that no one else knows - that they can live in a good peaceful coexistence. Hiccup stumbles upon a dragon himself, trains with him and soon learns many life lessons using his brain instead of his brawn in order to humble the dragons, in the hopes of proving all the others wrong.

The best thing about 'Dragon' is its attention to the characters - there is much time taken to build up the relationship between Hiccup and his black sheep dragon named Toothless. Lots of quiet moments are granted to us making this a very unique film about characters and how relationships grow despite cultural obstacles, really making this a parallel on society in a strange way. This is way different than the usual loud and obnoxious animated family films that rely way too much on impressing the audience with crazy special effects instead of giving them a good story. 'Dragon' does have much action and great effects on its own, but what makes this film work is that the effects are used to guide the story, not tell it. Hence, we get a great character story ALONG WITH all the great epic action to accompany it. 2 for 1, can't go wrong with it. 'Dragon' does not disappoint in all regards; it's definitely apparent the filmmakers put lots of effort into a well-told story as well as good special effects and animation. Moreover, we must understand that this story is not anything we haven't already seen before in a different setting, but the simplicity of the story and its reliance on character actions instead of constant monologues and dialogues granted by movies that simply talk too much and do very little.
Some people may be disappointed that the comedy aspect of this film isn't at the forefront. This is more of an action/adventure with some comedic elements simply SPRINKLED upon the film, but the movie is not made to be a comedy. The beauty here is that the story is so good, it doesn't ever matter to the viewer. You'll be too busy "whoah'ing to ever care to chuckle a cheap 'haha.' So no, 'Dragon' won't pull out any dumb and overused pop culture trendy lines in order to be loved by the latest Entertainment Weekly subscriber a la Shrek, nor will you find any sort of product placement nonsense. The filmmakers are here to give you an epic adventure, and on honing in on this goal it is then done incredibly well, you won't really care about anything else. The story may be simple, but since it's told so fantastically, you appreciate it anyhow.
This all leads up to an epic dragon battle finale which contains some of the best special effects editing and shot in recent animated film history, and I would have to say on a personal note that seeing action this intense and well directed is not something you'll probably find in any other family film out there. So if you're tired of just being fed little kiddie stories about cute animals walking around in colorful little worlds, check out 'Dragon' for some more intense action that dares to walk on a slightly grittier terrain. With a story full of dragons, Vikings and epic longships, you will not be disappointed.

On a technical side, and this is a pretty big point and one of the main reasons that make the Blu-ray copy of this film so appealing. That the film, in a nutshell, looks ABSOLUTELY IMMACULATE. The detail found on this Blu-ray transfer is simply stunning and jaw-droppingly GORGEOUS to any fan of High Definition video. Landscapes are clean and fully detailed, edges are sharp, colors are extravagant, smoke and light are eye-poppingly smooth, motion is flawless. Out of my collection of 130 Blu-ray titles, this would have to be on my top three in terms of visual detail, perhaps tying first place with Tron:Legacy, another epically gorgeous-looking film. I simply cannot say enough good things about how incredibly perfect the video detail looks on this blu-ray, and is way ahead of the visuals I saw in the movie theaters for this film.
Now to make matters even better, the film also contains one of the crispest, cleanest, most flawless audio soundtracks I've ever heard. The film runs on the latest TrueHD Dolby sound, and it is well noticed (even though other soundtracks that run on the same system don't sound nearly as good). Every sound is not only audible, from the voices to wind and fire battles, but every single sound is even, smooth and incredibly clean. The music in the film itself ever even borders on overtaking the film, and while the soundtrack score to the movie is great, the general volume level of it is kept at a respectable distance, guiding the film's entire feel, giving the viewer an almost subconscious trip into the world of the Vikings because it never boasts saying "hey, listen to me, i sound really good at the expense of the voices and other things." No, the soundtrack knows its place, as well as all the other sounds; nothing is ever too loud or too low, but there's other way to say it - it's juuuuust right. So just as the video is one of the absolute best I've ever seen, the audio soundtrack is one of the absolute best I've ever heard. It amazes me just how much work was put into making this blu-ray transfer this good.
In closing, in terms of blu-ray performance, I believe 'Dragon' should be playing on all retail store tv displays, if only to show the absolute maximum capacity of every television unit they are selling. Yup, it looks THAT good. My hat goes off to the transfer team to showing us exactly what the power of blu-ray can do. Hence a great story, great characters, and stunning presentation make this an easy pick for any movie fan.

I think most people were skeptical about this film when it came out because it hadn't been advertised very well and the title doesn't exactly strike a person as appealing. I wasn't at all interested in this film when it came out until some trusted associates began telling me how much they enjoyed the film. My curiosity was peaked and I rented the film and watched it with somewhat low expectations. The story is about a group of rising vikings that are being trained on how to kill a dragon. When scraggly, odd Hiccup manages to injure a dragon outside of school, he finds that he is unable to kill it as taught. He instead becomes determined to help the dragon recover and fly once more. This was a very good movie, and I'm not saying that because I had low expectations. DreamWorks seems to be a real hit-or-miss company with their animated films and this was the best one I've seen since Kung Fu Panda. The story was a lot more interesting than expected and the blend of humor and action was very well played. The characters were likable and had believable personalities and development, and that goes for the dragons as well. The animation style was a bit different and I heard some people say that it was too much of a video-game look to be enjoyed, but there were still some stunning visuals in the film and some very creative moments. The voice acting was very well done and the musical score for the film was amazing! You can't go wrong with John Powell; that guy is an amazing composer. Overall, the movie was a perfect mix of fun and comedy and should not be missed, whether you like the visual style or not. [...]
Enjoyed this movie, just wanted to rate it showing my appreciation for it. Great movie, and this isn't a review.
This is a fun story for kids and adults to watch over and over again.  A well thought out story with a good point.
My 2 year old daughter is a big fan of this movie. Every morning, she asks " I watch Dragon!"

I bought this movie for the kids(3&6), but I think I enjoyed it more. There is spectacular animation. The story line was more in depth than expected, not just a bunch of mindless humor. Although there were some very comical moments. I recomend this for any parents who are tired of all the infantile humor of most kids movies. Great movie for older children the 3yr old didn't seem to like it much. Heard there is a sequal in the works, can't wait.
I'm 23 years old with a love for animated movies. This movie was cute and had some nice humor about it. I bought it after seeing it on TV (did not go to the movies) and am glad I did.

I've watched it seven times in 3 months(I usually watch a movie once and forget it), and I make all my friends watch it. It is a fantastic movie about friendship and being the odd one out.  There are only a few points in the show where they could have made the movie a little more believable. But this movie is one of my favorite as well as my husband's! There are some little added gems that you can notice, like that they made the main character left-handed.

I really wish I could have seen this in 3D in theaters. Get the BLU-RAY and get a nice LED TV to really enjoy the graphics.

Every parent I know says this is one of their children's FAVORITE movies. And all the parents love it too!

The first time my daughters brought How to Train Your Dragon home (they borrowed it from a neighbor) I couldn't believe how enthralled I became. I've seen many movies, but I'm not exactly a *movie buff*. SO getting completely taken away by this one was a surprise.
The relationships in the movie are just priceless, especially between Hiccup and Toothless. Dragons have always been portrayed as massive meanies, and to find out they are actually "friendly" was just awesome.
If you haven't seen How to Train Your Dragon, then you won't know what you are missing. After the 20th time, we still get excited and so involved that we forget about everything else. I hope you have the same experience!
This is a good movie, with a good set of special features that show some aspects of how the movie is created.  Although predominantly a kids movie, it is enjoyable for adults as well.

I went out one day on a whim and decided to see this when it was in the theatre and I loved it!  I don't often always see a lot of the animated movies in the theatre, but instead wait until dollar theatre or Netflix or something, but I had seen everything else at the theatre at the time I wanted to see and wound up seeing this.  Loved it!  It was among one of the better animated movies I had seen around that time, other than like Toy Story 3, and later Rango and Kung Fu Panda 2.  I bought this up on Blu-Ray right when it came out and have watched it several times since.  If you're at all into animated movies, this is definitely one to watch.  It's overall pretty good for kids, though there are a couple of parts that might be scary.  I'd say it's good for maybe ages 5+.  In any case though, this is a must see animated movie!  I highly recommend it!

It's easy to say that the average person usually knows how to train dogs, cats, parrots, etc. Professional trainers and entertainers train lions, elephants, hawks, dolphins, etc.

Who would have thought that a toothpick-thin boy, who lacks both physical strength and athlete-like coordination, would be able to train one of the most vicious dragons through care, understanding, and friendship?

How to Train Your Dragon had to be one of the most lowly-anticipated movies of 2010. It was a so-called "Sleeper Hit" that provided satisfaction to children, teens, and adults. Like many others have said, the trailers did not do the movie any justice.

This movie ranks right up there with Toy Story and Ratatouille.

This Blu-ray set comes with two discs - a Blu-ray disc with the main and special features - and a DVD copy. There isn't a great number of special features, but it is adequate considering the stunning visual and audio qualities. Even the soundtrack is really good.

How to Train Your Dragon is a film for anyone to enjoy. It's a must-have for any movie collection.
I love this movie. It looks beautiful in blu ray. The movie has a great message, and doesn't have the inappropriate material that most movies do these days. Get it, and you won't regret it!

How to train your Dragon is a wonderful movie, even if it is completely unrealistic. If dragons keep on attacking the village, why does no one ever die, especially when the dragons are supposedly so ferocious? Anyway this item came quick and was cheap and looks freakin amazing on Blu-ray!

After seeing this movie at a friends house I just had to have it! Toothless is adorable and as always Dreamworks does an excellent job with story and animation. The characters are great, and they do a wonderful job of developing the relationships within the film: father and son, Hiccup and Toothless, Hiccup and Astrid and building friendships. It's a great movie for the whole family with jokes for every age group. The bonus items were also a plus! Having bluray and DVD is great, I can watch DVD on the go and bluray at home, I love options and versatility so this works perfect for home and travel.

This movie is adorable and now my new favorite animated movie. Strangely I haven't heard of it before my sister told me that it was her favorite. Not knowing what exactly she was talking about and why suddenly a person who usually is into hard core action movies, was into children's movies, I've rented it. And OMG, I thought that it was the most adorable movie ever. Through these 2 hours I've grown to feel for the Toothless and fell in love with this cure dragon. Separate thing to mention that the face expressions of the dragon are something else. Without saying a word you can read his thoughts and emotions. My favorite part was when he was offering the boy his half of fish to eat. But really really wanted to eat it himself.... I am pretty sure I had a huge smile on my face too. The move is packed with an awesome visual effects and a lot of adventure. If you haven't seen it yet, you should. You will love it.
This movie is geared towards children but me and my husband enjoy watching it just as much as our four boys do.  A hit with everyone and highly recommend. You won't be disappointed.

I'm not a big animation fan, although I do like some recent Pixar films and older Disney films. I loved this film. I thought the writing and characters and music and animation were all done so beautifully and gave a sense of atmosphere and definitely a sense of "epic". I was blown away. Perhaps it was my lowered expectations (weird looking dragon on the cover), but I was taken aback by how cleverly this story was told visually and artistically that I fell in love with it. I highly recommend for all ages.

This movie was loved by all three generations of my family. From 4 years old to 70, everyone loved this heartfelt story of the underdog coming into his own. Not to mention, the dialogue and the onscreen physical antics are hilarious.  If I could give this movie 6 stars, I would!

I turned on the television yesterday and this movie was on. I had no intention of watching the whole thing, but after a few minutes, I was hooked! "How to Train Your Dragon" is a wonderful story about a young Viking boy, Hiccup, who never warms to his people's love of fighting and killing dragons. Hiccup eventually encounters and befriends a dragon, who he names Toothless. (And let me tell you, this dragon is adorable...reminds me of my cat for some reason.) Together, Hiccup and Toothless join together to save Hiccup's people from certain doom.

This is such a wonderful story about friendship, morality, and about being kind to animals. I really enjoyed it and think it's a movie that all parents should watch with their kids.

My kids love this movie... I used to have it on my DVR, but that crashed and burned quick.
So i decided to get the Blue-Ray Version... Excellent color and great animation on my Plasma.

My kids really get into the movie.... just beware ... you might have a few little dragons flying around after the movie.  :)
This is a great movie for kids and it works well for adults too. It has valuable lessons for children and adults. The humor works for adults much like the Princess Bride.
This is a great father-son movie with lots of action and a wonderful plot line. The animation is spectacular and the dialogue and narration are first class. This movie is a winner!

This movie has almost no sexual remarks or refferences. There is one kiss however. I find this movie an excellent choice for my two or four year old. The animation is wonderful. It is also very well written. I could not ask for a better childrens movie

This Dreamworks masterpiece is Pixar quality. Actually, its better than anything Pixar has put out in the last couple of years.

The transfer is flawless as is expected from a digital animated feature. The audio mix is top-notch as well, and excels in an advanced home theatre system.

The movie is great fun for all ages and the writers seem to have an "inside line" into kid's brains. The characters talk and act like young people act today and there is a bit of encouragement for any youngster with a handicap. The best news, however, is the second disc which not only contains another movie, it has numerous activities that are truly fun and worthwhile for anyone with a computer and a color printer. Lots of "arts amd crafts" but also short cartoons about "Viking" olympics and a "test" you can take to determine what type of Viking you would be. This test is surprisingly accurate collating the answers and choosing one of the Viking characters as well as assigning you a Viking name. I,for example will now be known "as Olaf the Fastalker" and BOY is that name acurate for me. Just buy it for the sheer enjoyment but be sure to get both disks.

Although I haven't watched the movie myself, the kids and the rest of the family just loved it.  Also, it was great to have the DVD to use in the car and portable players and the blu ray for the house.
This is one of our family's favorite movies...such a touching story about love and acceptance.  Appealing to both the boys and the girls!
My daughter loved the movie and thought it was very cool how well they put it together. Good service as far as delivery and condition!

This is not just a story for the young.  It's interesting from start to finish.  You will watch it again and again.  Kids love it and so do us adults.  When I just want some good entertainment, I pop this one in.  It always makes me feel happy.
I thought this was 3D for some odd reason, but was still very happy with the blu-ray quality.  If you haven't seen HTTYD and like quirky, hilarious family animation, check this out now!

I'm not big on writing detailed reviews on movies, but wanted to give this 5 stars. Its original story and querky attitude make this a fun family movie. The dragons can be a bit scary for those 4 and younger, however it is wonderful movie with a good heart and a good message.

I had no interest in seeing this movie but I happen to catch it on cable and I thoroughly enjoyed it.  The story is simple and a bit "out there" but it actually works quite well.  I have since watched the movie several times and I always pick up something new.

The Blu-ray quality is amazing - audio and video are top notch.  There are also some good extras and I was glad it came with a dvd copy as well.

I would think this would be ok for children 7 and up.  Highly recommended!
My grandchildren have this DVD so bought it for our home.  They love it.  Good story line and keeps their attention.

Good movie.  Very funny with some good lessons and very little objectionable material (some violence that the little ones might get upset over).  The Discs themselves have some nice extras especially about the animation process which I found fascinating.

I wasn't sure I would like this film.  I am not that into dragons but I loved it.  The story line was original and the characters were great.  I am now a fan.  Waiting to see if there is a sequel in the works. I would recommend this movie to anyone who is young or just young at heart.
Can tell it's a real copy - the movie is great - creatively teaches that we should make an effort to be ourselves.  I wanted to be sure to get it for my children! The packaging from amazon was fine.

I avoided this movie for the longest time, thinking it would be a silly romp fit only for children with nothing better to watch, but boy was I wrong!  This is a very good movie with a great plot and amazing animation.  This would've been great at the theater, but even in 2D at home it was by turns breathtaking, funny and touching and throughout it was great fun to watch.

I never wanted to give this movie a fair chance, seemed like another 3D gimmick cash in at the time it released.  Not to mention the Dreamworks Shrek series went downhill quickly in my opinion, which also pushed my interest down for this movie.

If it weren't for the glowing reviews here, I would have never given it a chance, and now I'm kicking myself for not watching earlier.  I bet in 3D in the theater it would have been amazing.  Anyway, this movie is just great from start to finish and great for the whole family.  Highly recommend.
Despite the unfortunate title, this movie delivers. Amazing animation and a powerful script made this one of the best movies of 2010.

This is such a fun movie.  It shows a relationship between a boy and his pet.  The dragons go from being described by Hiccup in the first scene as pests to the last scene as pets.  My 3 1/2 year old loves this movie.  She watches it over and over and over again.  There is no bad language in this film and it shows how Hiccup goes from being a kid that everyone wants out of the way to being the Viking he always was.  My kids watch it at home, in the car - it's an awesome movie.  I would recommend it for families that have young kids that like to watch TV.  Or for a family night movie for kids and parents to enjoy.

This movie is wonderful for both kids and adults.  You quickly fall in love with Hiccup and Toothless and are rooting for them to be friends from the moment they meet each other.  Their relationship builds slow but proves to be strong as they face not only the disapproval of the Viking civilization, but also as they face the truth behind the world of dragons.

A really entertaining movie from start to finish.  Toothless is so adorable and you'll end the movie wanting a nightfury of your own.
I gave this to my husband, for Father's Day.  He is a real movie buff and he absolutely, loved this movie.  I think he has watched it, at least 20 times and raves about it, each time.

How to Train Your Dragon has all of the best qualities of Pixar/Dreamworks movies: the lovable characters, great CG graphics, and comedy. While the overall design of the dragons is comic, their skin looks incredibly realistic. I did however take one star off for lack of originality. In many respects, the plot is pretty predictable and the same as many other "boy-meets-the-enemy" type movies. The boy befriends the dragon a bit too easily, first with food then healing his broken tail fin. Overall, it's a cute story, and families will surely enjoy it, but I don't know how much enduring appeal it will have.

For the readers sake I shall be brief

This was way beyond my expectations

Extremely well dramatized, perfect actors voices brought real life to animated characters and drew you into the story that much more

Humour and on an equal adult/child level so all had fun watching

AMAzING CG ....on a "Pixar" level or better, very enchanting to menacing with wonderfully done action scenes...it grabbed your attention at all times

This was well written , acted, produced,and animated....there is not one thing any of us complained about !!!
All LOVED this and will be buying SOON!!

Recommend to all ages, you won't be disappointed
Hope this helps and ENJOY !!

I have to admit I did catch this movie in the theaters in 3D and I was a bit worried it would not be as good on just a Blu-ray (2D) format.  I will say though I was pleasantly surprised to see the graphics come through beautifully on my HDTV.  Now on to the story.

If you can stomach the first 15-20 minutes of the movie with the main character's awful nasally voice it does get much better.  After that you are in for a great movie.  The movie is full of adventure and great action sequences and is pretty funny.  The amount of detail gone into everything in the movie just makes it look really asthetically pleasing.  This movie will entertain those young and old and comes to a very thrilling finish.

Both of my boys (ages 8 and 2) loved How to Train Your Dragon! My oldest son actually saw it in the theater when it released but he was super excited when we received the DVD in the mail to review. He said "Oh my gosh, Mommy! I l-o-v-e this movie!" He and his little brother sat glued on the couch through the entire movie (without fighting once, I might add!). Even adults will enjoy this one - give it a try!
Absolutely at the top of my movie list. Brilliant and beautiful. One of the best adventure kids movies out there that all ages will enjoy.
This is a great movie for boys and girls. Even my husband doesn't mind watching this one with the kids. It is a must have for the home movie collection
I bought this DVD based on other reviews. My whole family enjoyed it trenendously. Even my college kids who are too old to enjoy anything with us.
This movie is great. We bought it for our son and he loves it. It was well worth the low price.
The movie was a good price, comes in DVD and Blu-Ray, and was delivered on time. The movie itself is en enjoyable animated story, fast paced and humorous.
A good entertaining and clean movie the whole family can enjoy. It's nice they offer it in the combo pack so you can watch the DVD at the places you may not have Blu-ray, like on your laptop.
The movie is a favorite of my children and at the great price on Amamzon we are able to watch it in Blue-Ray at home and the regular DVD in the Car.  It is a great story of empowering yourself!

This movie kept me laughing and intrigued. It was very witty for adults and kept my toddlers attention as well. We are very happy with our purchase.
Only regret is that we couldn't find the digital copy with disc combo.
Great Movie, my son is 4 years old and he absolutely loves this movie. He watches it every-night so he can fall asleep.

My son is 2 and he enjoys this movie thoroughly.  He runs around all day talking about dragons and loves the main character "Hippock!" (Hiccup)  I thought he would be too young to enjoy this movie at the age of 2, but he really seems to know what is going on as well as a 2-year-old can and is captivated by this movie whenever it is on.

A definite keeper!

Ordered this BD movie here at amazon, was on sale and so I thought what the heck. I have seen bits and pieces of this movie from a bootleg copy to a DVD and an HD sampler showing at the displays at Sears. Didn't think it would ever be of my liking, was I ever wrong. Read the reviews at high end blu-ray sites and this is one of the best movies to showcase your home theater, (and so they say). Boy they are right! Pop this baby this morning on my PS3 and kick the sound through my Bose system. Wow! nothing short of spectacular. This movie, right to the part where Astrid was riding on the back of Toothless hugging Hiccup when she said "It's AMAZING". Well, this movie is freaking Amazing!; could be the best of the bunch. I recently bought Incredibles, Megamind, Cars, Kung-Fu Panda, Monsters vs. Aliens, etc..- all on blu-ray! None of them comes close to this movie. From the storyline to the jaw-dropping special effects to the sound, it all comes to play. Like I said, the video quality is the best. Heck it's probably the best movie I've seen on my 63" Samsung Plasma (real movie and animated). Dreamworks outdid themselves this time on visuals; Unbelievable details. You can see every fiber on the clothing as if they were real. The characters seems like they are almost popping out of the screen but not to the point where it looks surreal. A great family film not just for kids but adults as well. The storyline will have you weeping. The special effects will have you in awe, from the characters to the high flying mystical and magical dragons. You will be thinking about this movie even after you've seen it. Trust me, I'm in the process of collecting blu-ray for my home theater. So far, this is the best both in visuals, sound, and storyline.  Popping it again tonight for round 2.

P.S. - I know some audiophiles out there may be thinking or bashing Bose systems. I personally like my Lifestyle 12. Served me well for over 12 years and it still kicking. Friends are still amazed at how much those little speakers sound. Thumping base and crisp mids for the dialogues in movies. I know and heard of better systems and probably need an upgrade but my motto is and always will be - If it's not broken, don't fix it! so there! hope you enjoyed this review and make sure to get the movie mentioned above. You will not regret it! Thanks amazon! =)

Follow-up: Just finished watching the special features. Amazing how the characters from the story came to the big screen. The author who wrote the story is a genius. Watch that part of the special feature, just made me appreciate the movie even more. Very smart, entertaining, and feel-good movie!
The whole family loved this movie and the blu-ray version looks great. We haven't really watched the DVD version, but the disc itself is in good shape.

I love this movie and so do my boys.  I had viewed this movie previously before buying it.  This is the best price I came accross for the Blu-ray combo pack.  I mainly got it for my boys because they talk about it all the time.

How to Train Your Dragon (Two-Disc Blu-ray/DVD Combo + Dragon Double Pack) [Blu-ray] I must state here & now that this review is based solely on the Blu-Ray Version as it is the only version I have viewed at this time. Awesome animation, great story line, extremely entertaining & suitable for family viewing ... almost. The exception being very, very young children. Albeit this movie is animated & most certainly suitable for children, it contains scenes in which dragons are growling, baring their teeth & attacking children which may frighten the very youngest among us. I enjoyed How To Train Your Dragon immensely & I highly recommend it for family viewing at the PARENTS DISCRETION. Parents know their children. What may frighten one four year old may not frighten another. As we have both a DVD player & a Blu-Ray player, it is nice having this movie available on both DVD & Blu-Ray discs. Most especially in the event either player should break down or eventually become obsolete. Price point is always a consideration. However, Amazon priced this Duo just right. Both the DVD & Blu-Ray Versions are in Widescreen format & of course, both are in Color. The Blu-Ray is 1080p HD in English 5.1 Dolby True HD. Other languages include French, Spanish & Portuguese all of which are in 5.1 Dolby Digital. Subtitles include English, English SDH, French, Spanish & Portuguese. The DVD Version is, as mentioned above, presented in a Widescreen format with the black bars at the top & the bottom of the screen. Languages include English, French & Spanish in Dolby Digital 5.1 Surround & English 2.0 Surround. Subtitles are in English, French & Spanish. The DVD is Widescreen Enhanced for 16X9 televisions.
We weren't impressed by the previews for this movie at all...in fact I didn't even want to see it! It's one of our favorites though, it's such an adorable movie!

This movie is one of my kids (5 & 3) favorites!!  My husband and I liked it as well.  This was well done, loved the story line and the color and graphics were great!!  It was well done and had good humor in it as well.  Definitely one to have in your library of movies!!  Dreamworks did a great job on this one!!!

This is a good all around family flick. I'm over 60, and I'd heard enough about it from everyone I know who had seen it that I picked it up. No regrets about that. It's fun and entertaining, and if you've ever tried to train a puppy, you'll get a chuckle out of this one. Highly recommended.
My family enjoyed this movie.  It is good fun.  Doesn't take much thought or concentration -- just enjoyable fun.

Loved it ! The movie looks awesome and it has a lot of values in the extras.
Worth the money. A must have animated film.

love the dvd. the movie is really good just the bonus dvd is blue-ray. so if you don't have one you might not want this.

Great dvd thro

We have two boys that just love this movie (particularly the 3 year old).  It's entertaining for parents too.  The combo pack is great as we keep the Bluray at home and can take the DVD in the car with us.

This was my hands down best movie in 2010.  It handles a lot of adult topics in a way that is simple but makes sense, and wow, you don't even realize you're learning something.  My children love it even after the 54th time they've watched it.  All the adults who's seen it love it too.  Great movie and a keeper in my library.

While I normally do not write review I want to spreed the word on this wonderful movie. This is without a doubt my favorite of all animated movies. In fact at this moment I like it more then any movie in general. The art is fantastic, the story is great, the characters are adorable. It has more depth then any of the other Dreamwork's animations I've seen. However, it is not at all like the book that does not stop it from being a wonderful movie on its own right.

I would recommend this movie to anyone of any age. I love it, my 6 year old nephew loves it his 1 1/2 year old sister loves it, as do many of my friends in college, and my mother!
Great movei!  It's my new favorite.  My whole family loves it.  When I didn't get this DVD for Christmas, I had to just buy it for myself.  And the price was great for a DVD Blu-ray combo.

This will be short. I will just say that this is an excellent film for anyone of any age. The story is fun with many humorous moments that will make anyone laugh out loud.
The Blu-Ray is very well made. The pictures is crystal clear and does not suffer from too many "this should be in 3D" moments. I saw this film in 3D at the theater and honestly the 2D production of this film loses nothing. The sound editing is that went into this movie is also done very well; it is simply amazing. For those who have a higher end audio system are in for a real treat as well since the HD audio track has many extra audio queues that aren't present in the non HD audio track. This movie has as another bonus for anyone who has a dedicated powered sub in their audio system. The bass management in this film is outstanding. I would it even rivals movies like War of the Worlds and The Incredible Hulk.

As sentimental as I am, Toy Story 3 won me over for animated movie of the year.
How to train your dragon was a close second. A great 3d movie, well made, excellent story
and teaches a lesson to kids!

Amazingly enough Dreamworks dropped the childish fart jokes and kept this movie pure and a classic.
I will be watching this one for years to come

LOVE LOVE This movie!  We were first introduced to this movie by my brother-in-law. At first I was like "Great... a dragon movie." But when I saw this movie for the first time, I was in LOVE!  Great action and it has wonderful morals!  Perfect for the whole family! Do yourself a favor and GET THIS MOVIE!!!!  You will thank me later!

This is a great movie.  I highly recommend it, as it is truly an original story with a gripping plot that is fun for the whole family.  I am a huge fan of animated movies and this is one of the best I have seen.  You know you are getting a quality product when you pop in a disc that says either Pixar or DreamWorks.  Not to take away anything from Toy Story 3, but I thought this was better.  Gerard Butler is great, and Jay Baruchel provides the quirky kind-of-off performance that shines through in this epic tail.  Give it a chance, I am sure you will like it.

I thought this movie was great. You get a kid who doesn't fit in but wants to belong in his own way. He's open-minded (or at least creative because he likes to tinker/invent things brought about by apprenticing as a blacksmith) and willing to take chances (risk his life not knowing if he may get dead for his huge curiosity for Toothless). He gets to learn that dragons aren't as bad as he was taught once given a chance. There's also the parent/teenager awkwardness which has it's funny moments. The traditional beliefs vs. trying a different path. I like Hiccup's sarcasm and witty remarks... just says what he's thinking which gets him in trouble.

There are some things I'd like to point out as a reply to what some 1 star reviewers said...

1. I've never read this movie as it's book form first. As it seems to go for most book-turned-movie. They are almost always different because of changes. Just accept it and stop comparing the book version vs. the movie version. In fact, it always does seem better to watch the movie first... enjoy it for what it is then go read the book and it makes reading the book version infinitely better because then it becomes more in depth. IMO... movies always are condensed versions of the book unless you want a 6 hour movie or a trilogy. And imo again, in condensing the movie, in order to make things make sense and skip explanations of many things, the story gets changed along the way.

2. Another 1 star poster said that in the end of the movie... what happened to Hiccup's leg was too graphic. Really?! I don't recall seeing blood and gore and a mangled leg... What about the blacksmith Gobber? He's missing an arm and a leg... was that graphic? What about Gobber telling the story of how it happened... wouldn't that be more graphic? Rhetorical question. I feel sad for Hiccup that it happened to him but I believe it was written in the story to show how that makes the bond between the boy and his dragon stronger... you may not realize it at first but when they walk away from the "camera" towards the door... that's when it really hits you... Hiccup... Toothless...

3. Emo hair? Uh no... Just a plain haircut...

4. The dragons were not cute puppies... Actually IMO, they were... or at least Toothless was more like Stitch mixed with a cat. He had Stitch's curiosity, occasional similar body movement and personality without being gross. (And I do love Stitch too. He was hilarious.) Toothless moves like a stalking cat. I felt that way halfway into the movie. I only even got the inclination to watch the movie after a glimpse of the movie during the Oscars. And the funny thing is... I didn't find out that the codirectors and cowriters, Chris Sanders and Dean DeBlois (who made Lilo & Stitch) had anything to do with the movie until today. I guess their style was just that evident in Toothless.
GREAT MOVIE!  The animation just gets better and better!  Funny and very entertaining.  I recommend this movie to everyone I know!

As an earlier reviewer said, I wouldn't recommend this movie for younger children.  We have a 4 year old who loves Shrek and Over the Hedge.  We let him watch part of this movie, but it was quickly apparent that the material was a little too intense for him.

If you are considering this movie with the thought that a child under the age of 7 might watch it, I would reconsider.

Don't get me wrong, this IS a fantastic movie.  You should still buy it, but save it for your older kids (and yourself!).

I took my youngun' to see this movie when it was still in the theater. BEST idea EVER! This movie struck me so, that we then went to the bookstore & bought the first half of the books written by Patricia Cornwell that the movie was loosely based off of. Now, the movie was remarkaby good, but...the book series...well, I will just say that the movie doesn't quite follow in the exact same fashion...for instace - in the book, Toothless is QUITE a different sort of dragon, but not in a bad way..really, he is quite a silly little "untrained" scrap o' nuttin in the book, but..makes for quite lively stories!
My "take" on the movie, is that it will get you "tingling" and emotional in a zillion different places inside of you, but, when the movie is over, &, you are just begging for more, - don't hesitate to head straight to your local bookstore to get the REST of the 'JOURNEY'...we did ourselves, &, have been grateful ever since.

This is a great family movie!!  My kids loved it & wanted to watch it everyday!  However, I would recommend that children be 7 years old or older before watching this movie.  It's a little violent.  Nontheless, it has a good story line that keeps you engaged all the way to the end.

We have found this to be one of the most intertaining movies ever!
It is similar to a boy and his (wolf)dog kind of story, but on a much grander scale! We have watched it several times, back to back. It will be in our MOST FAVORED collection for some time.

This movie is so great - I have nothing bad to say about it.  Great plot, great characters, great visuals.  I literally "aww"-ed and "ooh"-ed through the whole thing, and even held my breath a few times.  And I'm an adult with no kids - this movie is for everyone!  I would totally watch it again.
if you have the equipment and want to see this in full high def then this is worth the money.

This movie is amazing! and its so much better in Blue-Ray. I bought it for my bf for Valentines with a PS3 and i was so excited to see the difference i couldn't wait so i gave it to him then. He loves this movie. Perfect for all ages. not to mention i placed my order at like 4 in the afternoon and it came the very next day. :))) Im very Happy

We are big fans of a lot of the Pixar movies.  They set a very high bar.  This movie meets that level of quality in story, humor, animation and voice acting.  My wife loved it.  Since we watched it for a movie night, my son has watched it at LEAST 5 more times.  Excellent movie.  Great purchase.

That's a very very good blue-ray. I recommend to have it. It has all the extras I needed/expected to have. And the best of all, it has portuguese-BR language and subtitle.
Amazon delivery was in time. Actually, they delivered one day before the schedule here in Brazil, and I paid a lot less than this absurd prices here. :)

The movie looks amazing and is really great.  I would like to make one comment as I have 2 boys - 3 years old and 5 years old.
They say "Kill" a tremendous amount of times in the movie and the kids pick up on this.  I am no prude by any means and Disney has plenty of issue with their kids movies as well.  I do have friends who won't let their kids watch as the mention of killing over and over is a bit much.

In my opinion this is pretty much the ultimate animated film on both a technical level and as a great presentation of a good story. The quality of the technical aspects of the work is WAY ahead of any animated feature I've seen. The water scenes are so real visually it is hard to register in one's mind they aren't actually IN, UNDER OR ON water. The texture of the clothing, hair, skin on the people characters is amazing as is the skin and scales of the dragons. The story is essentially a father/son relationship tale with "coming of age" scenario of a young man trying to communicate his character and worth to a father who is locked in a mindset of his son being inept and more of a village liability than an asset. Throw in the angst of adolescence with its issues of peer acceptance and a seasoning of boy/girl stress/awakenings and the result is a good tale relatable to a broad spectrum of ages.
This is a great family friendly movie.  My son watches it all the time and my husband even enjoys this great movie. Great little catch phrases & great animation.

Honestly, when I saw the first ad for this movie on tv, I thought it was going to be another forgettable, cheap animated clunker. My kids wanted to see it at the theater, and I reluctantly assented. Within the first two seconds of the movie, I was laughing harder than I'd laughed in a movie theater in ages. The originality of the characters and situations (from a Viking king named Stoic the Vast to a crusty warrior named Gobber with the voice of the always hilarious Craig Ferguson) was refreshingly unique from the film's first frame. The action moves quickly as Hiccup, Stoic's misfit son, tries comically to fit in. The adventure story is satisfying to kids and parents alike with a heart-warming theme that everyone can relate to: a child desperate to earn a parent's love. We got the dvd when it first came out, and we all loved it just as much the second time around. My husband agreed that the movie was much better than he'd expected. I highly recommend this movie as a wonderful family film.
This is a great movie that the whole family can enjoy. The fast pace of the story, the amazing graphics and the morals portrayed make this an isntant family favorite.

this is a great movie i love this movie and i love the characters. i wish i had a pet dragon like toothless that would be cool. and the boneknapper movie is awesome to. i love these movies. great for all ages
One of the best CG animated films I have seen in years. The storyline flows well and is a great movie for the entire family!
This is a very cute kids movie that kept my two year old's attention the entire time. It has a good moral to the story while still having fun the entire time.

I loved this film, and I initially thought I wouldn't.  I love Pixar movies, and compared to Dreamworks, Pixar has usually won.  But this movie is outstanding.  Shame on the Oscars for picking the overrated "Toy Story 3" over this movie.  "How to Train Your Dragon" and even "Tangled" were superior projects to "Toy Story 3", and I'll say that to anyone.

Both my wife and I really enjoyed this film; now that's saying a lot, especially where my wife is concerned as she will often walk out on a video we are watching after the first few minutes if she doesn't like it. This is a captivating family film that features a compelling story and interesting characters.

Both the video and audio are top notch with the action battle scenes with the dragons dramatically involving the surround speakers; one definitely gets a feeling of being in the middle of the action!

I believe this one will bear up to repeated viewings even for the adults, it's a fun movie!

Oh my god. How to train your dragon is amazing. I love it. I wish there was another chapter of the story. I'm in luv! Legend of the  BoneKnapper Dragon was 16 minutes in length, 13 minutes of which was the movie itself. It is too short and the story feels too simple, and undone. It could be a lot better.
Awesome family movie,I need a dragon for pet way cooler than a dog (no offence Bolt ).Animation always looks better on HD sets so I love it .
This is a great movie. Very entertaining and fun for the whole family. It is a good plot with nicely designed dragons they are also very creative. I  hope they make a sequel to this movie.

Being different can be tough as growing up when you are trying to fit in. Once you accept it, you become unique! Like any animation movie - there was a message in the movie and a happy ending. Dreamworks did a great job with the plot and its characters. I could easily recognize the deep voice of one of the Vikings - Gerard Butler. Losers became heros and the "dangerous" dragons turned into adorable pets. What more could I ask. ;) Overall a fun movie and would recommend to watch. The quality of the movie was great on my TV. It was easy to setup my amazon account on my player and watch from Amazon On Demand. Enjoy!

Really awesome movie.
I watched this movie without any expectations and just blew my mind.
This bluray still has a very interesting short-movie. And the extras are very good.
Definitely worth the purchase.
This is such a great family movie!! Cute, artistic, detailed. In blu-ray it's just fab! Myself, my kids and everyone i work with has watched it multiple times.

Who knew that Jay Baruchel sounds exactly like Christian Slater? I mean my wife and I we're shocked when the credits rolled and saw that the lead voice of Hiccup was played by Jay, um, uh, Barawho and not Slater. Anyway.... How to Train Your Dragon is a great family movie and it came recommended to me by several friends that don't even have kids. Now, I've seen some animated features (like The Incredibles) that could potentially make my all time list of favorite movies, but I'd have to think hard about any animated movie that would make it into my top 20 of all time. And of my top 20 favorite movies half would likely only get 4 versus 5 stars. Dragon would land on a separate list somewhere only in about the middle of the pack of just my favorite "animated" movies. It's a good movie...but classic? Nah. Against his father's will, the timid Hiccup sneaks out with a new weapon he designed. Turns out the weapon works pretty well and he brings down the most feared dragon in the land with it. The weapon doesn't kill the beast, and as the title of the movie might suggest, Hiccup instead forms a friendship with the monster that could change human/dragon relations forever. I was thoroughly entertained. My wife thought it was okay. My kids...they liked it. No one was wowed. Perhaps I've spoiled my family with my liberal stance of letting them watch pretty much anything they want (within reason). Or maybe we've all just overdosed on reruns of the early SpongeBob Episodes on DVD. Cuz, I'll tell ya what, if you said to me that Nick is running a marathon of the first 50 SpongeBob episodes or Cartoon Network is premiering How to Train Your Dragon, I'd been tuning into Nick. Toy Story is a 5 star animated movie. Shrek is a 5 star animated movie. Even A Bug's Life is a 5 star animated movie. How to Train Your Dragon is a really good animated feature that will soon be forgotten by all who watched on my TV set. Don't get me wrong...Dragon is definitely a worthy rental at minimum. It's just not a classic. But as of this writing about 90% of the other reviewers here might disagree with me, so please take my review for what it's worth: an opinion.
me gusto mucho esta pelicula.. y la edicion blu-ray trae un corto extra.. nada se compara a una pelicula en blu-ray

purchased this DVD for my Grandson for Christmas, Great Condition and he loved it. and the price was right. the shipping was in good time. so I rate this seller with 5 stars... thanks for making my Christmas shopping easier.

I saw this movie in the theater with a few friends, we're all college aged adults, so that says a lot about the draw factor of this movie. It's got plenty of action and adventure, but also a lot of heart! I think a lot of people can relate to Hiccup (main character) trying to fit in, having family issues with a militaristic father who's gone a lot, finding his own special talent, and standing up for himself when he has to. I loved the end of the movie when Hiccup has a life changing event, no spoilers, but it gives a shout out to a lot of people out there who are marginilized, or not often thought of. We never get to see characters like this in movies, it's so refreshing to see. Toothless, the dragon, is absolutely adorable, too!

I wasn't very engrossed by the first twenty minutes or so, but then it seemed to really gel and I loved the rest. The animation is typically fine Dreamworks stuff, though I wish I'd seen this in 3D in theaters, as many shots are clearly set up to highlight those effects, and while they look fine in 2D, it's clear that we're missing another semi-dimension. But that's no big deal, as the film is in general quite winning.

The voice work is all good, with Gerard Butler the most convincing. I really liked Toothless' look, and the highlight of the film is the boy-and-his-dragon aspect; it's always kind of funny when animation makes you tear up a bit. But anyone who's ever really loved an animal friend knows how that goes.

The blu-ray transfer is quite good, though not quite as amazingly crisp as Up or Kung Fu Panda. There are a few extras, a brief doc on the voices, but it's not an especially great BD package, merely decent.

All in all, a very good-looking, heartfelt movie, one of the best animated films of 2010 that I've seen.

You can't help but love this movie, about a kid who doesn't seem to fit in with his own Viking family and their Viking ways.  Great message and lots of action and humor for both children and adults! Love it!!

How to Train Your Dragon is one of the best films I've seen if not ever than at least in the past 10 years. I'm now over twenty but I have quite a few cousins under 12 so I bought this after seeing the dvd version of the film my aunt had gotten. Great moral dilemmas, good character development, great plot, and stunning visuals make this movie one of my new favorites. All of my cousins love this movie and not surprising so so their parents. It's truly going to become a new family classic, at least in my family.

This is has become my favorite movie of all time. There's something about the connection between the main character 'Hiccup' and the dragon 'Toothless' that surpasses all other "buddy films" in recent memory. The depth of the story almost makes it a drama, but my emotions while watching this film ran the gamut. The animation, of course, is beautiful. If you did get to see it in the theater in 3-D, then you got a treat. One of the few movies using 3-D appropriately. But, nothing is lost watching a "non 3-D" version. Part of the magic that makes this a 5-star film is the soundtrack/score. Seriously well done.

Great movie. Kid's favorite, great lessons for kids. Everybody agrees, cutest dragon ever.
Loved it in the movie theater. Still a great movie in 2D at home.
Just wish I didn't have to buy all the different discs. At this point I just want the blu-ray. Then again, would be a good movie to play for kids in the den where there's only a DVD player, and no blu-ray. Price was good anyway and really worth it. These discs will probably get multiple plays.

I took my children initially to see this at their first drive in movie.  From the start this has been a good movie.  It teaches some great concepts about learning and how to fit in even with your differences.  It has some great humor in it and is well told.  The rating is set right on this movie.

I love that the studios have combined the blu-ray with the DVD packs.  The blu-ray looks great in the home theater but having the DVD as well allows us to travel in the car with the DVD player that we won't soon be swaping out for the blu-ray.  Good call!

Why isn't this movie in Blu Ray 3D! I totally missed watching it in 3D and I want a second chance :(

This movie was fantastic, and I don't know anyone who didn't like it. I even own some of the movie figures myself! They're just too cute not to own in my opinion :)
I haven't read the books,sadly. Thought the movie had a great storyline, very entertaining & fell in love with the dragons.

This is one of the best movies I've seen in a long time.  I have probably seen it 5 or 6 times in the last few months and am not growing tired of it.  It's a great and very realistic story about relationships and finding out who we are created to be, taking risks for what we believe in, and going after it with everything you've got.  They did a great job telling the story.  You connect with all the characters, definitely Hiccup.  And you definitely connect with the relationship with Hiccup and Toothless.  You are rooting for them from the beginning.  The animation is stunning, some of the best I've seen.  The collaboration with Cinematographer Roger Deakins really paid off.  The movie looks amazing.  They take you through the gamut of emotions from joy and laughter to dread to tears and back again.  I highly recommend this movie.  It has taken a place among my top 10 movies, alongside "The Matrix" and "Lord of the Rings (Trilogy)".  It's at least worth the rental, even if you don't decide to own it.

I bought this for my kids for Xmas 2010 and it was fantastic!  Simply put it is one of the best blu-rays next to the Alien Quadrilogy this year.  Great story and fantastic visuals and sound.  As an adult with 3 kids I watched this from start to finish never leaving my chair.  The kids wanted to watch it a second time but I made them wait until the next day.  This is simple no problem recommndation.  At $18.99 w/free S&H and no tax it is a must.  It comes with a DVD that we can watch in our minivan as well.
Such an adorable movie for kids and adults alike! My 4 year old nephew and I both loved this film.

We rented this movie for our 4 yr old son at the recommendations of one of my husband's coworkers. He loved it from the first few minutes. From that point on I knew we had to get it for Christmas. It teaches a lot of good lessons and even has been recommended by Parents Magazine as one of the videos that teach good moral lessons that kids should watch. Yes it does deal with Vikings & Dragon Killing for part of it but it's all to teach a good lesson...it doesn't have any unnecessary violence and it's animated so no blood and guts etc. Great movie we've recommended to several of our friends & definitely plan on recommending to more

My first purchased item from Amazon.com and definitaly a great choice !
Amazing video quality specially in a 32" LED TV !
The extras and special history are also special too !
There is PT-BR subtitle for everything (movie, extra, etc.)
The main movie is great. Forget about the second it's bad and not worth getting it. Short, not interested, really bad.

First of all I consider myself a loyalist to the Walt Disney Company. I've had a year pass to Disneyland for a while. I even worked for the studio for a bit. However, this is the first time I've felt like DreamWorks Animation was acting as competition for Disney/Pixar.

How to Train Your Dragon is a great film. It doesn't include the usual fart and bathroom humor jokes that are usually found in the DreamWorks movies. There is actual conflict, you like the characters because it's a heartfelt movie. There is a drama, comedy and beautiful landscapes. The characters are likable without being over the top obnoxious. I once heard that Pixar films are for the child in every adult and that DreamWorks films are for the adult in every child. That mostly reverenced the irreverent humor that kids didn't quite understand, but liked to repeat. I think this film changes the game for DreamWorks Animation. Bravo to DreamWorks!

As far as the Blu-Ray goes, it gets straight to the point. There are not a lot of things that force you to watch for 5 straight minutes (Shrek 2 DVD anyone?) before you can get to the feature presentation. It's easy to navigate and the compression on the film is beautiful. There are some good special features, but I haven't spent a lot of time watching them because we've been watching the film over and over again.

I challenge you to buy the film and not like it. It's close to impossible.
I thought this movie would just be good for a cartoon, turns out it is just a really good movie!

This is a very funny motion picture. They've taken a lot of the precepts we have about dragons and blown them right out of the water. I watched with nieces and nephews, ages 8-13 and everybody was really entertained. We enjoyed the extras on the disk as well. Highly recommended, a good time for kids and adults.

I cannot say enough wonderful things about this movie.  The story is great. The animation is awesome and breathtaking.  The humor is wonderful.  The music is phenomenal & moving.  I think this is a wonderful family movie; full of laughter ,love and perseverance.  After watching this movie, I can guarantee that you will want to own your own Night Fury!

My wife and I are big fans of computer animated movies, especially ones from Pixar since Pixar normally makes the best ones.  Dreamworks, however, has been doing way better lately and this is probably the movie that puts them on par with Pixar.

Amazing animation, great voice acting, fun story and some real creativity make this movie a gem.  Wife and I have watched it 3 or 4 times already and will certainly watch it many more times over the years.

Only disappointing thing about this specific item is that it doesn't include a digital copy.  Not a big deal because digital copies aren't even close to being as cool as they should be, but its come to be expected.

Buy this movie and enjoy it!

Simply out, this movie is amazing for 3 reasons.

1. It's a movie about people taming Dragons in a friendly way to be able to ride them.

2. The bond that develops between Hiccup and Toothless is so realistic, it seems like that is the right way to start a friendship with a dragon.

3. The thing that really sets this movie apart from other children's epics (movie with large adventure feel and action suitable for kids) is that there are actually high stakes for the two main characters in this movie. And they both suffer in a way that won't scare kids but also that adults will be able to recognize.

The voice acting is superb, the action scenes are amazing, the scenery and environments are GORGEOUS, and the music is not just fitting for the movie, but grandiose in its execution.

Get this movie. Right now. If you have a blu-ray player of some sort, get on blu ray. It's jaw dropping.
Bought this DVD set for my grandson for Christmas and it was an instant hit, watched the same afternoon right away and then again and again. Lots of fun and excellent animation!
Thanks, was disappointed the second bonus DVD was only 16 minutes. But nobody's fault but mine for not checking into the package more. Still love the animation and the story. Thanks
The whole family loves this movie. It is something we can all sit and watch together. I highly recomend it for any disney, fantisy fans.
Good movie my 3 and 4 yr olds really enjoyed it and I love toothless he is very cute and funny.

The Blu-Ray of "Dragon" is amazing, some sequences look as though I am still seeing it in 3D. The story is wonderful and the entire movie just works. Craig Ferguson was actually really good in this, and the short film that is included features Ferguson as the main focus, it's really funny and a wonderful extra to an already pitch perfect film. You don't just have to be a kid to enjoy this one. The last 15 minutes is as action packed as any live action feature. The movie is a lot of fun, looking forward to more in the series.

There is something special about this film, and I have a hard time putting my finger on it when describing it to my friends.  The high-quality picture and sound that Blu-Ray delivers, the fantastic voice acting, well-timed comedy, and the surprisingly emotional score all bring this movie to the top of the list.  But there is something else at work here, something that must be seen to be truly understood.

I'm not sure if one has to have a pet (which I do) to appreciate this, but the bond between Toothless and Hiccup as the story progresses is powerful.  I'm a guy and a few parts of the movie really hit me hard.  The last 15 minutes of the movie contain some of the most emotional storytelling I've seen in a movie.  You'd have to be one of the coldest people on earth to not feel something during those scenes.

The CGI is incredible.  Facial expressions, especially the expression in Toothless's eyes, look so lifelike that it's made this one of my featured Blu-Ray movies when I want to show off my Hi-Def setup.  For a fun comparison of how lifelike the graphics are, watch the "Legend of the Boneknapper Dragon" extra feature.  It jumps between a traditional cartoon and CGI.  When it goes back to the CGI, it's funny how real it will look.

Not only is this a great Blu-Ray title, it's one of the best animated films ever created.  I highly recommend it.

I loved "Kung Fu Panda" so couldn't wait to see this movie when it came out (Dreamworks Studio made both).  I loved this film.  Probably the best use of 3D I have seen at a theater as well.  It looks FANTASTIC on blu-ray.  This is the only studio that is close to the quality of Pixar presently.  If Toy Story 3 hadn't been released this year, there is no question this film would win for best animated film at Oscar time.  In fact, it may give TS3 a run for its money.  It's that good.  This is also a great film to showcase your home theater system.  Not only does it look fantastic, it sounds fantastic as well.  Very intelligent dialogue, lots of humor, great animation, what more can you ask?

Just for the start, this was a great movie, we enjoyed a lot the story. Talking about the product, was perfect to have the dual DVD-BR, since we just have the BR-player in the living room and the DVD player on the bedroom.
Also the new story of the movie was a refresh in the history.

This is a review of the Double DVD Pack Edition, not the movie itself. I bought it because it seemed like all the special features had been included in the "Boneknapper" DVD and so I figured I had to buy the extra disc to get them. Not true. The "Boneknapper" DVD has a few short "features", most of which are games and print-outs. There are a few "Deleted Scenes" but most of the dialogue was included in the movie already. These scenes are more like earlier/alternate scenes that do not add much insight into the movie. Not what I was looking for. The "All-New Dragon Adventure" is cute, but only about 13 minutes long - not worth spending an extra 7 or 8 dollars to get it. Basically, my advice is save yourself the money if you are planning on buying this movie and get the single-disc edition instead.

I rented this movie on demand.  I have to say I am not a big fan of this movie.  It dragged and wasn't really funny.  I would only suggest to rent this movie and not to buy.  It's not one I would watch again.

Wow.  I thought Avatar was just "pretty good" after seeing How to Train Your Dragon.

This movie was fantastic.  Story, production, characters, music.  Everything.  I watched it twice in the same sitting.  That is something I have never done before!

This movie is good for anyone.  Family, kids, adults.  And the soundtrack is great too.
Both DVD and BD are great. When I put the DVD by mistake, I really thought it was de BD because the image and sound quality. Great motive, great combo!

My kids and I love this movie- it is about a misfit Viking who discovers an unknown truth about dragons. Now he just has to change the views of the entire Viking population and upset everything they have ever known. This movie is very cute, and Toothless' personality makes many of the scenes. We have not opened and viewed this copy, so I cannot comment on the bonus material, but I know my son will be thrilled with this gift under the tree!

A very creative, slightly different take on the long tradition of dragons and humans story. A typical fun lighthearted story and visually stunning; dragon concepts are quite creative as well. Hightly recommended for my whole family.
How to Train Your Dragon is my 8 year old granddaughter's favorite.  She watches it constantly.  Also, the second DVD is wonderful.  I recommend this set to everyone who still dreams.
We ordered this movie for our grand children! They loved it! I think this movie has a very wonderful message! The kids enjoy their movies at home and in the car!

I loved it in the theaters and it looks so much betetr on Blu-ray on the HD set.  Would have loved to get the 3D version but it is only available through a voucher redemption with the purchase of a new Samsung 3D TV.  Video and sound quality is amazing and both my daughter(3) and son(8) love this movie.

This is an awesome movie, that like all quality animated films, looks wonderful on blu-ray.  I haven't watched any of the special features, but the bonus dvd has already allowed us to watch the movie in rooms in our house and with friends that haven't upgraded to blu-ray yet.

We got this movie last week and have absolutely love it.  My wife wanted it for the kids for a long time now and I finally ordered it without them knowing.  They were so happy when it arrived and have watched it at least twice a day.  Its a very beautiful movie with a great story thats been repeated here a lot.  I came downstairs this morning and wondered why it didn't look very good to what I had seen.  I realized that the kids put the DVD version instead of the Blu-ray one.  The DVD is nice but the blu-ray is fantastic the audio is great.  My wife even made the comment "This is the first time I feel like wee need a bigger TV."  Of course I was secretly smiling at this.  We currently have a 58" Samsung plasma(Also ordered from amazon earlier this year) .  I also liked this movie a lot and was better than I imagined.  now about that bigger TV?
Arrived well packed and within just a coupe of days. Returned to UK with it and it worked fine on my converted DVD machine and has no pauses or other pay back problems
This movie is my 3 and 5 year old kids favorite movie. We have had this movie for a few months and it is still there first pick on Movie day.
Everyone who has seen this movie love it.  The story line is good along with the graphics.  Even though the blue ray is not in 3D the movie is still great.

This is one of the most enjoyable animations I've ever seen.  I loved the creativity in every aspect.  The colors are vibrant, ethereal in places.  The story is well cast and well done.  This is a keeper.
Best animated flick I've seen in a long time. Great story, great action, superb graphics and sound. Moves along at a good pace..no sleeper moments. Highly recommended.

"How to Train Your Dragon", which my friends refer to simply as "Dragon" is such a great movie. If you haven't seen it yet, it is definitely worth the purchase. It is a shame that it wasn't marketed better for the theatrical run.

With a little luck, Dragon might win the Best Animated Feature and even Best Picture this year!

At first I thought that this movie was a little dark and scary for younger viewers but my 2 year old grandson just loves it.  The Blu-Ray set is fantastic and shows great on my 50" tv.  The extra cartoon with the set is fun but really un-necessary, the movie carries this DVD.  I hope to see more of Hic-cup and his friends in future movies.

I had hesitations about this movie, so we decided to rent it first. We have never watched a movie back to back so many times, it was that good. I'm sure we played it at least 8 times in the first three days we had it. The humor is quick and on many levels. I worried that it would be too scary for my 4 and 5 yr old (girls), but they only got worried right at the beginning. Each time we watched it, we'd find new humor and still laugh at the old. Actually laugh. Right out loud. I'm sending it back today - every one is sad, but it will give us a break and I'll order this one for Christmas.

I fell madly in love with this movie the first time my sister-in-law insisted I see it.  As a person who has read Cressida Cowell's series, I will be the first to admit this has not a single thing to do with its source book, but wow, this is an animated movie of heart among animated movies.  It's wonderfully simple while still boasting plenty of emotion. It's funny.  It's snappy.  The animation and music are gorgeous.  And hey, who doesn't love dragons?

The story is of a Viking boy named Hiccup who is the worst Viking of his tribe. He's shrimpy, too smart-alecky for his own good, and he happens to be the over-protected son of the chief.  The tribe has been waging a centuries-old war with the dragons who prey on the same food suppy, so Hiccup believes that if he kills a dragon he will finally earn some respect.  So he invents a machine to shoot down a dragon, accomplishes the conceptual goal, and sets about killing it.  Only he is unable to.  Instead, he winds up making a pet out of the dragon he names Toothless.

This movie is, by all definitions, adorable.  The kids will love the cute dragons, the teen set will love the hint of teen romance and all the action, and as an adult I was intrigued by both the relationships in the movie as well as the pure movie-making art.  Truly, there is something for everyone.

The blu-ray/dvd is standard and suitable blu-ray/dvd entertainment, though it seemed most of the good stuff was added to the blu-ray, leaving the dvd itself with very little.  Still, we get the commentary (I love commentary), a pop-up fact track (lots of fun), deleted scenes (always interesting) as well as a fun little Viking personality quiz.  Not to mention the short movie, which I found quite enjoyable.  Nothing terribly special, but certainly worthy.

Still, the reason to buy anything is the movie itself.  It's enchanting.

good quality DVD/Bluray
movie is fine, good work done behind,
